creator: Daniele Folatelli
descriptionHtml:
With this app you can very quickly and smoothly calculate scores for the Ticket to Ride board game and all it's extensions. It is intended to be used as the game finishes and all points are counted.

You can score points for:

Routes: Click on the number indicating route in train cars length. Undo button for editing. Only lengths for the game board extension are shown. Number of train cars left are indicated to validate that all routes were accounted for.

Destination Tickets: Click on the number indicating destination ticket points. With a simple click you can do the complete tickets and incomplete tickets. Undo button for editing. Buttons for only points the actual destination tickets in the extension are shown.

With the app full version bonuses are scored according to each board game extension!! All bonus points are awarded according to the rules. Each extension requires some information to be input as indicated below:

Longest Route: Input longest route in train cars for each player and the points are awarded to the player(s) with the longest route with the bonus corresponding to the extension.

Globetrotter: No need to input anything. Points are awarded to the player(s) who completed the most destination tickets with the bonus points corresponding to the extension.

Europe Stations: Input how many stations were used for each player; 4 points are for each.

Rails and Sails Ports: For each player indicate if each port was used and how many destination tickets for that port were completed; points are awarded accordingly.

Africa Double Routes: Input how many routes were made with terrain cards for each player; extra points are awarded accordingly. For this expansion it is necessary to simply take note of routes made with terrain cards for each player during game play.

India Mandalas: Input how many completed destination tickets are in the mandalas for each player; points are awarded accordingly.

Asia Mountain: Input how many train cars were used for mountains for each player; points are awarded accordingly.

Nederland Toll Tokens and Loans: Input how many loans were taken and toll tokens at the end of the game for each player; points are awarded accordingly.

Pennsylvania Shares: For each player input how many cards and best card for each share; points are awarded accordingly. For two player games input the dummy player information with the half of the cards that are used for scoring.

United Kingdom Cards: For each player indicate the cards that were bought; points are awarded accordingly. Only cards that award points are considered. For the Steam Turbine card input number of ferries built at the time the card is bought and ferries at the end. For the Double Heading card input number of routes built at the time the card is bought. For this expansion it is necessary to simply take note of this information during game play.

Márklin Passengers: Input merchandise points for each player; points are awarded accordingly.

Germany Passengers: Input number of meeple passengers at end game for each player; points are awarded accordingly. Ties are considered for scoring as indicated in the rules.

Old West Cities: This extension requires input during game play. Each time a route is built and there are cities take note of points for cities. Points are awarded for player(s) that owns the city and subtracted for the player that built the route so they are subtracted from the regular way of inputting route points.

Visit us at https://timetocount.com

“Ticket to Ride” is a registered trademark of Days of Wonder, and this site is not associated with Days of Wonder.

descriptionHtml:
With this app you can very quickly calculate scores for the Ticket to Ride board game using any of it's extensions. It is intended to be used as the game finishes and all points are counted.

The app stores history of scores as well as shows best scores for each game board variant of the game.

Routes: Click on the number indicating route in train cars length. Undo button for editing. Only lengths for the game board extension are shown. Number of train cars left are indicated to validate that all routes were accounted for.

Destination Tickets: Click on the number indicating destination ticket points. With a simple click you can do the complete tickets and incomplete tickets. Undo button for editing. Buttons for only points the actual destination tickets in the extension are shown.

With the app full version bonuses are scored according to the rules in each board game extension!! Bonus information is recorded for each player. Some bonuses have views to see how players rank for the bonus. Each extension requires some information to be input as indicated below and points are awarded:

Longest Continuous Path: Input longest continuous path in train cars for each player. The bonus corresponding to the specific extension is awarded to the player(s) with the longest continuous path. There is an option to only input the player(s) to be awarded the bonus score and not enter each player's longest path.

Globetrotter: No need to input anything. Points are awarded to the player(s) who completed the most destination tickets with the bonus points corresponding to the extension.

Europe Stations: Input how many stations were used for each player; 4 points are awarded for each.

Rails and Sails Ports: For each player indicate if each port was used and how many destination tickets for that port were completed; points are awarded accordingly. Also the lost points for exchanged pieces are recorded to adjust the final score for each player.

Africa Double Routes: Input how many routes were made with terrain cards for each player; extra points are awarded accordingly. For this expansion it is necessary to simply take note of routes made with terrain cards for each player during game play.

India Mandalas: Input how many completed destination tickets are in the mandalas for each player.

Asia Mountain: Input how many train cars were used for mountains for each player.

Nederland Toll Tokens and Loans: Input how many loans were taken and toll tokens at the end of the game for each player.

Pennsylvania Shares: For each player input how many cards and best card for each share; points are awarded accordingly. For two player games input the dummy player information with the half of the cards that are used for scoring.

United Kingdom Cards: For each player indicate the cards that were bought; points are awarded accordingly. Only cards that award points are considered. For the Steam Turbine card input number of ferries built at the time the card is bought and ferries at the end. For the Double Heading card input number of routes built at the time the card is bought. For this expansion it is necessary to simply take note of this information during game play.

Márklin Passengers: Input merchandise points for each player.

Germany Passengers: Input number of meeple passengers at end game for each player. Ties are considered for scoring as indicated in the rules.

Old West Cities: This extension requires input during game play. Each time a route is built and there are cities take note of points for cities. Points are awarded for player(s) that owns the city and subtracted for the player that built the route. This subtraction is to net out with the route points counted in the Route screen.

Longest Continuous Path: Input longest continuous path in train cars for each player. The bonus corresponding to the specific extension is awarded to the player(s) with the longest continuous path. There is an option to only input the player(s) to be awarded the bonus score and not enter each player's longest path.

Globetrotter: No input. Points are awarded to the player(s) who completed the most destination tickets with the bonus corresponding to the extension.

Europe Stations: Input how many stations were used for each player; 4 points are awarded for each.

Rails and Sails Ports: For each player indicate if each port was used and how many destination tickets for that port were completed; points are awarded accordingly. Also the lost points for exchanged pieces are recorded to adjust the final score for each player.

Africa Double Routes: Input how many routes were made with terrain cards for each player; extra points are awarded accordingly. For this expansion it is necessary to simply take note of routes made with terrain cards for each player during game play.

India Mandalas: Input how many completed destination tickets are in the mandalas for each player.

Asia Mountain: Input how many train cars were used for mountains for each player.

Nederland Toll Tokens and Loans: Input how many loans were taken and toll tokens at the end of the game for each player.

Pennsylvania Shares: For each player input how many cards and best card for each share; points are awarded accordingly. For two player games input the dummy player information with the half of the cards that are used for scoring.

United Kingdom Cards: For each player indicate the cards that were bought; points are awarded accordingly. Only cards that award points are considered. For the Steam Turbine card input number of ferries built at the time the card is bought and ferries at the end. For the Double Heading card input number of routes built at the time the card is bought. For this expansion it is necessary to simply take note of this information during game play.

Márklin Passengers: Input merchandise points for each player.

Germany Passengers: Input number of meeple passengers at end game for each player. Ties are considered for scoring as indicated in the rules.

Old West Cities: Each time a route is built and there are cities take note of points for cities. Points are awarded for player(s) that owns the city and subtracted for the player that built the route. This subtraction is to net out with the route points counted in the Route screen.

New York: Indicate how many attractions were visited for each player.

London: For each player Indicate which districts were completed.

“Ticket to Ride” is a registered trademark of Days of Wonder. This site and the developer are not associated with Days of Wonder.

title: Ticket to Ride - Time To Count - Score Assistant

creator: Daniele Folatelli
descriptionHtml:
Use Time to Count to quickly calculate scores for the Ticket to Ride board game. It is intended to be used as the game finishes and all points are counted.

Time to Count supports all expansion boards, and expansions are added soon after they are available:

- Original USA board and USA 1910 expansion
- Europe and Europe 1912 expansion
- Nordic Countries
- Rails and Sails
- The Heart of Africa
- India / Switzerland
- Asia / Legendary Asia
- Nederland
- United Kingdom / Pennsylvania
- Márklin
- Germany
- France / Old West
- New York
- London
- Amsterdam
- Stay at Home
- Japan / Italy

When you first download the app you can score points for the original USA board. You have the option of buying the full version for just U$S 2.99 at anytime. With the full version you can then choose between all game expansions and the bonuses are scored accordingly!

The app stores history of games played and best scores for each expansion.

Find in the app help screens that show you how to count scores for each bonus. For all bonuses that depend on the comparison between players the app has views to see how players rank for the bonus.

When scoring for routes, you have an undo button for editing. Only lengths for the game board you are playing are shown. Number of train cars left are indicated to validate that all routes were accounted for.

Count destination tickets with a simple click. You can add the complete tickets and incomplete tickets. You also have an undo button for editing. The app shows only the destination tickets for the selected game board.

When determining the Longest Continuous Path bonus input longest continuous path in train cars for each player. The bonus corresponding to the specific extension is awarded to the player(s) with the longest continuous path. There is an option to only input the player(s) to be awarded the bonus score and not enter each player's longest path.

For the globetrotter bonus points are awarded automatically to the player(s) who completed the most destination tickets with the bonus corresponding to the expansion.

All other bonuses are explained in the app with help screens for each expansion.

“Ticket to Ride” is a registered trademark of Days of Wonder. This site and the developer are not associated with Days of Wonder.

The app stores history of games played and best scores for each expansion.

Find in the app help screens that show you how to count scores for each bonus. For all bonuses that depend on the comparison between players the app has views to see how players rank for the bonus.

When scoring for routes, you have an undo button for editing. Only lengths for the game board you are playing are shown. Number of train cars left are indicated to validate that all routes were accounted for.

Count destination tickets with a simple click. You can add the complete tickets and incomplete tickets. You also have an undo button for editing. The app shows only the destination tickets for the selected game board.

When determining the Longest Continuous Path bonus input longest continuous path in train cars for each player. The bonus corresponding to the specific extension is awarded to the player(s) with the longest continuous path. There is an option to only input the player(s) to be awarded the bonus score and not enter each player's longest path.

For the globetrotter bonus points are awarded automatically to the player(s) who completed the most destination tickets with the bonus corresponding to the expansion.

All other bonuses are explained in the app with help screens for each expansion.

“Ticket to Ride” is a registered trademark of Days of Wonder. This site and the developer are not associated with Days of Wonder.

When you first download the app you can score points for the original USA map (or the Europe map if you live in Europe). You have the option of buying the full version for just U$S 2.99 at anytime. With the full version you can then choose between all game expansions and the bonuses are scored accordingly!

The app stores history of games played and best scores for each expansion.

Find in the app help screens that show you how to count scores for each bonus. For all bonuses that depend on the comparison between players the app has views to see how players rank for the bonus.

When scoring for routes, you have an undo button for editing. Only lengths for the game board you are playing are shown. Number of train cars left are indicated to validate that all routes were accounted for.

Count destination tickets with a simple click. You can add the complete tickets and incomplete tickets. You also have an undo button for editing. The app shows only the destination tickets for the selected game board.

When determining the Longest Continuous Path bonus input longest continuous path in train cars for each player. The bonus corresponding to the specific extension is awarded to the player(s) with the longest continuous path. There is an option to only input the player(s) to be awarded the bonus score and not enter each player's longest path.

For the globetrotter bonus points are awarded automatically to the player(s) who completed the most destination tickets with the bonus corresponding to the expansion.

All other bonuses are explained in the app with help screens for each expansion.

“Ticket to Ride” is a registered trademark of Days of Wonder. This site and the developer are not associated with Days of Wonder.

- Europe including Europe 1912 and Orient Express expansions
- Alvin & Dexter
- Nordic Countries
- Rails and Sails
- The Heart of Africa
- India / Switzerland
- Asia / Legendary Asia
- Nederland
- United Kingdom / Pennsylvania
- Märklin
- Germany
- France / Old West
- Poland
- New York
- London
- Amsterdam
- Stay at Home
- Japan / Italy
- Play Pink
- San Francisco
- Custom Map (there's an option to add your own map!)

When you first download the app you can score points for the original USA map (or the Europe map if you live in Europe). You have the option of buying the full version for a small price at anytime. With the full version you can then choose between all game expansions and the bonuses are scored accordingly!

In the options screen you can switch languages between English and Spanish.

The app stores history of games played and best scores for each expansion.

Find in the app help screens that show you how to count scores for each bonus. For all bonuses that depend on the comparison between players the app has views to see how players rank for the bonus.

When scoring for routes, you have an undo button for editing. Only lengths for the game board you are playing are shown. Number of train cars left are indicated to validate that all routes were accounted for.

Count destination tickets with a simple click. You can add the complete tickets and incomplete tickets. You also have an undo button for editing. The app shows only the destination tickets for the selected game board.

When determining the Longest Continuous Path bonus input longest continuous path in train cars for each player. The bonus corresponding to the specific extension is awarded to the player(s) with the longest continuous path. There is an option to only input the player(s) to be awarded the bonus score and not enter each player's longest path.

For the globetrotter bonus points are awarded automatically to the player(s) who completed the most destination tickets with the bonus corresponding to the expansion.

All other bonuses are explained in the app with help screens for each expansion.

“Ticket to Ride” is a registered trademark of Days of Wonder. This site and the developer are not associated with Days of Wonder.
